title: Ciara and husband Russell Wilson bear uncanny resemblance to Beyoncé and Jay Z
text:
Celebrities far and wide are competing for the best Halloween costume.

And Ciara and her husband Russell Wilson certainly put themselves in the running on Tuesday as they transformed into music icons Beyoncé and Jay Z in a mock up of the couple's Apes**t video, which was released in January.

Beyoncé and Jay Z filmed the Apes**t video - the first from their album Everything Is Love - in front of the Mona Lisa in Paris' Louvre gallery, before the Goodies singer, 34, and the American footballer, 30, recreated the clip on a set this week.

Who's who? Ciara and her husband Russell Wilson certainly put themselves in the running on Tuesday as they transformed into music icons Beyoncé and Jay Z in an incredible snap which sent her fans wild in the comments

The couple looked incredible in their outfits as they replicated the suits and hairstyles worn by the couple in the video.

Similarly to the Crazy In Love hitmaker, Ciara wore a plunging pink suit with no bra underneath alongside a vast diamond necklace and coordinating earrings while her waist was cinched with a red rope belt - just like Beyoncé.

Russell donned the same blue suit as Jay Z and donned a vast gold chain with a heavy pendant as well as his longer tresses.

Ciara and Russell did opt to make a tweak to the shoot as they stood in front of a photo of Michelle and Barack Obama, rather than the iconic painting by Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci.

Wow! In an incredible scene from the January video for Apes**t - first music video from their collaborative album Everything Is Love - the couple stand in bold suits in front of the Mona Lisa, in scenes shot inside Paris' Louvre gallery

Who's who!? Ciara nailed the costume from the January video for the hit song

Who dat? The couple looked incredible in their outfits as they replicated the suits and hairstyles worn by the couple in the video

Far from limiting the shoot to just photos, Ciara and Russell mouthed the words to the song while also replicating the moves from the video.

Not keeping the holiday just for themselves, Ciara and Russell also got their kids in on the action with an incredible dress up.

Ciara's son Future Zahir Wilburn, five, who she shares with her ex Future, and her and Russell's daughter Sienna Princess Wilson, two, donned impressive costumes as they dressed as The Jacksons in cute pink ensembles.

Standing in front of speakers, the tots oozed Seventies cool in their stylish ensembles as they pranced around and sang in front of the camera.

Rock on: Ciara's son Future Zahir Wilburn, five, who she shares with her ex Future, and her and Russell's daughter Sienna Princess Wilson, two, donned impressive costumes as they dressed as The Jacksons in cute pink ensembles

Dance off! She even copied Beyoncé's dance moves while lip syncing to her song

Imitation is the sincerest form... Russell also perfected the look yet opted to leave his jacket open unlike Jay Z

Shocker: Ciara's tribute to Beyonce and Jay Z comes four years after Ciara caused shockwaves in the Beyhive when she made bold comments in an interview with The Guardian

Ciara's tribute to Beyonce and Jay Z comes four years after Ciara caused shockwaves in the Beyhive - the name given to Beyoncé's legion of admirers - when she made bold comments in an interview with The Guardian.

When she was asked how she feels about becoming as big as stars including Beyoncé and Rihanna, she said: 'Everything's about timing. I've had records just as big as those artists, I've had number-one songs around the world...

'My biggest competition is me... I don’t see myself beneath Beyoncé and Jay Z – I’m in my own world’.

Wowwee! After stunning fans with the videos and photos, Ciara stepped out in New York later in the day and looked sensational in all white
description: In an incredible scene from the January video for Apes**t - first music video from their collaborative album Everything Is Love - the couple stand in bold suits in front of the Mona Lisa
